Key Match Events: De'Aaron Fox led the Kings with 35 points, while Domantas Sabonis had 17 points, 21 rebounds and seven assists
Paul George had a big game with 30 points, eight rebounds and five assists, but fouled out late
Tyrese Maxey had 27 points, two rebounds, six assists and four steals, while Eric Gordon added 14 points off the bench
Pre-Game Insights: The Kings were coming off interim coach Doug Christie's first victory, defeating the Dallas Mavericks on Monday
The Sixers were trying to extend their winning streak to five games
Post-Match Reflections: It was a great win for Sacramento, lighting the beam to start 2025
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was tied at 57-57 after the first two quarters
The Sixers had an 89-80 advantage heading into the fourth period
The Kings slowly chopped the lead little by little until the score was tied at 107 with a minute remaining in regulation
Others: The Kings dominated the majority of the period before PG took over and gave the Sixers the much-needed momentum
The Sixers had it won, but they failed to take care of the basketball. Paul George had two costly turnovers, while Maxey also had one late that led to DeRozan's layup tying the game
